items.value: An airplane can fly without wings.
The Wright brothers invented the first successful airplane.
A jet engine uses a propeller to generate thrust.
The black box on an airplane is actually orange.
All airplanes have the same number of engines.
The wings of an airplane are designed to generate lift.
Airplanes can only fly during the day.
The tail of an airplane helps with stability.
A pilot needs a license to fly an airplane.
Airplanes cannot fly in the rain.
A helicopter is a type of airplane.
Commercial airplanes usually have a flight attendant.
The cockpit is where the passengers sit.
Airplanes can travel faster than the speed of sound.
The fuselage is the main body of an airplane.
Airplanes can only take off from airports.
The landing gear is used during takeoff and landing.
The wings of an airplane cannot be moved.
An autopilot system can fly an airplane without human intervention.
All airplanes have a maximum altitude they can fly.
An airplane’s speed is measured in knots.
A propeller-driven airplane is called a jet.
Airplanes need oxygen tanks to provide air for passengers.
The flaps on an airplane’s wings help to slow it down.
A jumbo jet is a type of large passenger airplane.
The altimeter in an airplane measures speed.
All airplanes have a copilot.
The Concorde was a supersonic passenger airplane.
An airplane’s engine can run on electricity.
The vertical stabilizer is located on the tail of the airplane.
Airplanes can only fly in clear weather.
A biplane has two sets of wings.
Airplanes can be used for firefighting.
The landing gear is always extended during flight.
The rudder controls the yaw of an airplane.
Airplanes are powered by solar energy.
An airplane’s altitude is measured in feet or meters.
The first airplane flight was in the 18th century.
Airplanes can be refueled in mid-air.
The ailerons control the roll of an airplane.
All airplanes are equipped with parachutes.
An airplane’s speed can be affected by wind.
The wings of an airplane can change shape.
An airplane can hover in place like a helicopter.
The F-22 Raptor is a type of military airplane.
Airplanes cannot be used for cargo transport.
The wingspan of an airplane affects its lift.
Airplanes are always faster than cars.
The Boeing 747 is known as the “Queen of the Skies.”
Airplanes have only one method of controlling direction.
A seaplane can land on water.
Airplanes always have a backup pilot.
The angle of attack affects the lift generated by an airplane.
Airplanes can fly upside down.
All airplanes have four engines.
The primary function of the elevator is to control pitch.
An airliner is a type of commercial airplane.
Airplanes cannot fly over mountains.
Airplanes are used for medical evacuations.
The maximum speed of an airplane is called its stall speed.
Airplanes can take off vertically like rockets.
An airplane’s wings generate thrust.
The term “mayday” is used to signal a distress situation in aviation.
All airplanes are made of metal.
The wings of an airplane are always level with the fuselage.
An airplane’s rudder controls its altitude.
The first powered flight was in 1903.
Airplanes can fly backwards.
An airplane’s navigation lights help it land at night.
Airplanes can be controlled remotely.
The F-16 is a commercial airplane.
Airplanes can carry cargo and passengers at the same time.
The nose of an airplane is called the bow.
Airplanes use flaps to increase lift during takeoff.
Airplanes cannot be used for scientific research.
The vertical stabilizer is used to control the roll of an airplane.
Airplanes can only be flown by humans.
The landing gear is retracted after takeoff.
Airplanes have a maximum takeoff weight.
The wings of an airplane are used to generate thrust.
An airplane cannot fly with only one engine working.
The Concorde could travel at twice the speed of sound.
An airplane’s flaps are used to control yaw.
The Wright Flyer was the first powered airplane.
Airplanes cannot fly through clouds.
The tail of an airplane helps control its direction.
Airplanes cannot fly faster than 500 miles per hour.
The Boeing 737 is a type of fighter jet.
An airplane’s wings are always flat.
The rudder is part of an airplane’s tail assembly.
Airplanes can be refueled while flying.
The nose of an airplane affects its aerodynamics.
Airplanes can fly in a straight line indefinitely.
An airplane can land without its landing gear.
Airplanes have to follow specific flight paths.
The F-35 Lightning II is a type of commercial airplane.
The ailerons help control an airplane’s roll.
The wings of an airplane can be folded.
Airplanes can take off from water.
The Concorde was known for its slow speed.
